title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations. $$3x+2y=-3$$ $$-x-2y=-19$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. y will be eliminated and then solve for x. $$2x=-22$$ $$x=-11$$

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text: Substitute $$x=-11$$ into the first equation, $$3x+2y=-3$$. Then solve for y. $$3x+2y=-3$$ $$3\left(-11\right)+2y=-3$$ $$-33+2y=-3$$ $$2y=30$$ $$y=15$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is (-11,15).
